name: Gouda and Spinach Stuffed Pork Chops
author: moonshine7015
summary: This turned out absolutely delicious!  It's become a much requested dinner - and is fairly easy to make!
ingredients: ½ pound fresh spinach, rinsed and torn into bite-size pieces
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Coat a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray
Lay each chop flat on cutting board, and with a sharp knife held parallel to the board, cut a pocket into the pork, leaving three sides intact
Stuff each chop with spinach, and then with cheese
Place panko crumbs in a shallow dish
Coat each chop with a thin layer of horseradish, and then roll in crumbs
Arrange chops in prepared baking dish
Sprinkle with Creole seasoning to taste
Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until brown and crispy
